item.title: Whole street litter picking needed, 3rd October
item.description:
Once again litter picking didn't take place as it was meant to on thursday, same litter can still be seen that has been there all week, this is an issue for this whole area, litter picking doesn't happen weekly as it should and builds up, it then results in reports here which are again closed saying action taken but often nothing has happened, if litter picking occurred weekly as its meant to the reports here wouldn't be needed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89, Southlands Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish flowing from property onto road, 3rd October
item.description:
Either resident or fly tipping. Both loose rubbish and bags of rubbish frequently left outside house. Frequently goes on pavement and road
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cavendish Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings have worn away, 3rd October
item.description:
Cars are driving straight across this junction into the park without slowing down and checking the way is clear. This is a clear danger for other road users, pedestrians and dog walkers. The junction road markings are practically non existent and there is no give way sign. The junctions of Transmere Rd and Kenilworth Rd have recently been repainted. Eynsford Close junctions (and the park entrance) need repainting too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eynsford Close, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 x permit holder signs removed from posts, 3rd October
item.description:
Having returned to London and parked up, I noticed 2 metal brackets on the ground. Looking up, I noticed that both paking permit signs, which had been cleaned, were missing from the posts. The third sign, obscured by an uninsured vehicle, was turned away facing the tracks. If Westminster council is allowing free parking, perhaps those of us who have paid for the permits should be due for a refund?.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paveley Street, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter blown from near by house with a stack of rubbish outside it, onto the green. Also loads of dog poo on the pathway and green as per usual, 3rd October
item.description:
Litter from near by house who have a stash of litter outside their home has blown over to the grass green. There’s also loads of dog poo on the pathway here and on the green as per usual. When will you put a sign for these issues?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Gravelwood Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous domestic dumping, 3rd October
item.description:
Hi, thanks for clearing this location after earlier report. However, bags, boxes and all sorts of items are being dumped here daily. Please could we have some enforcement/signage/other action. Or perhaps the bin could go back to the other side of the road?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet
